diagnostics suppression
CRoute shall check the BusOff state.
The initial value shall be BusOff=inactive.
Note: BusOff=active is reported when BusOff was inactive before and TEC reaches 256. BusOff=inactive is reported only when a transmission on this CAN was successful.
BusOff state is not the same as BusOff active. BusOff state can be detected after each recovery time while BusOff active is changed to inactive only when a message was transmitted.
The rules for incrementing TEC are defined in the CAN 2.0 specification.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10082 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Vlan_Node_Timeouts_Detection.c.test line 974 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/Evof/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Vlan_Nodes_Enable_Conditions.c.test line 606 When BusOff state was reached three times in sequence without having been able to successfully send any message then CRoute shall consider this as "failed test" for the related DTC, provided that
1) NWD is enabled as indicated in SWR_ICAS1_GW_10010 and 2) the other enable conditions (e.g. codings) are true for the relevant CAN bus.
The relevant conditions will be defined in chapter "Diagnostic Trouble Codes", if there are any.
Note: In Ereignisspeicher a qualification time of 0s is defined. This time starts after the test failed. Only afterwards the TestFailed bit is set. Time for detecting "failed" is 3x(time for detecting a BusOff) + 50ms + 200ms. Time for detecting a BusOff (TEC reaches 256) is about 64us.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10083 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

a message after BusOff active had been detected, CRoute shall
1) reset the "failed test" condition for the related DTC
2) reset the BusOff counter I.e. it takes another three BusOff detections to qualify the error again (and reach "failed test")
Note: Afterwards the de-qualification time defined in Ereignisspeicher starts.

here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.c.test line 300 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.c.test line 482 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.c.test line 580 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.c.test line 629 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.c.test line 699 When no message is received on the related bus for a specified time, i.e. when time tGLOBAL_TIMEOUT elapses without having received any monitored message, considering 5% of tGLOBAL_TIMEOUT as tolerance, then CRoute shall set to active the related TestFailedThisOperationCycle bit (i.e. TestFailed and ConfirmedDTC bits are set at the same time), provided that
1) NWD is enabled as indicated in SWR_ICAS1_GW_10007 and 2) the other enable conditions (e.g. codings) are true for the relevant CAN bus. I.e. at least one node must be coded and learned.
For qualification of Global Timeout CRoute shall monitor the node messages (500ms cycle time), using tGLOBAL_TIMEOUT = 2000ms 5%. t_message_timeout is equal to qualification time in GW_Ereignisspeicher This qualification time is also defined in GW_Ereignisspeicher.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10077 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10079
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: ErrCanGlobalTimeoutMonitor ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/inc/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.h line 96 Requirement is satisfied here: ErrResetCanGlobalTimeoutCounter ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/inc/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.h line 145 Requirement is satisfied here: if ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/src/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.c line 447 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.c.test line 631 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Global_Timeout_Detection.c.test line 701 When KN message from coded node is received on related CAN bus, CRoute shall
1) set the related DTC to passive.
2) reset the qualification time/counter. I.e. the qualification time tGLOBAL_TIMEOUT for a CAN bus shall be retriggered directly after each reception of any monitored message on that CAN bus.
Note: For detecting Global Timeout CRoute monitors the nodes messages only.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10079 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10095
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: ErrCanSingleWireMonitor ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/inc/ErrHdl_Can_Single_Wire_Detection.h line 101 Requirement is satisfied here: ErrHdlIsSingleWireErrorPresent ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/src/ErrHdl_Can_Single_Wire_Detection.c line 179 Requirement is satisfied here: if ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/src/ErrHdl_Can_Single_Wire_Detection.c line 346 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Single_Wire_Detection.c.test line 324 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Single_Wire_Detection.c.test line 520 Since CRoute is bus master it shall monitor the CAN buses for single wire errors.
In CRoute CAN transceivers without error pin are used.
Thus CRoute shall calculate voltage values read from HAL and determine single wire state as following: (sw_diff_AI_CANX <= 0,1V) AND (sw_AI_CANX_L >= 3,2V) AND (sw_AI_CANX_H >= 3,2V) (sw_diff_AI_CANX <= 0,3V) AND (sw_AI_CANX_L <= 0,3V) AND (sw_AI_CANX_H <= 0,3V) (sw_diff_AI_CANX <= 1,55V) AND (sw_AI_CANX_L <= 0,4V) AND (sw_AI_CANX_H <= 1,55V) where in CANX, X is a CAN bus ID and "sw_diff_AI_CANX" is a differential voltage between CAN Low and CAN High
Remarks: This is the same approach as implemented in MQB_19, i.e. Clamping Diagnosis leads to determining state "single wire" or "not single wire".
The related requirements for detecting state "single wire" shall be described in the HSI.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10095 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

Requirement is satisfied here: ErrNodesTimeoutMonitor ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/inc/ErrHdl_Can_Vlan_Node_Timeouts_Detection.h line 152 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/ERRHDL_MQB/c/test/swut/ErrHdl_Can_Vlan_Node_Timeouts_Detection.c.test line 1027 0x21200C - Timeout Node 0x000C / Bus 0x12: Controller for Steering Column Electronics no communication
When the software receives from the GW signal:
- Node message failure and the failure is contiuously active for 2.5 s, it shall set the DTC 0x21200C as Qualified,
- Node message received or encoding removed, it shall set in time 0 s the DTC 0x21200C as Not Qualified.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_3346 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: #TBD# ASIL: QM
